function.name: normm
function.short: Norm of a multivector (norm of each element for arrays)

long.para: norm(x) computes the norm of a multivector or multivector array. "We get the norm |M| of a multivector as |M|2 = M * M̅ = ‹MM̅›0 = m2 0 + m2 1 + m2 2 + m2 12."[1]

references.reference: Eckhard Hitzer, Introduction to Clifford's Geometric Algebra, Journal of the Society of Instrument and Control Engineers, Vol. 51, No. 4, pp. 338-350, April 2012, (April 2012), page 4, equation 40 http://arxiv.org/pdf/1306.1660.pdf
